jobDescription: Northrop Grumman is seeking a Data Scientist to support our Headquarters, Department of the Army (HQDA) Office of the Deputy Chief of Staff G-1, Army Resiliency Directorate (ARD) team in Arlington, VA.The research team conducts advanced analytics and research support for the Department of Defense (DoD). The team works primarily within a data environment that contains administrative, personnel, survey, and medical data representing millions of individuals.Projects focus on health, resilience, and readiness among military service members, and include population-based studies, machine learning applications, measurement analysis, and pilot program evaluations.The Data Scientist will support several projects. Primary tasks include: developing data mining and modeling plans; describing, exploring, and verifying data quality; selecting, cleaning, constructing, integrating, and formatting data; selecting modeling techniques; generating training, testing, and validation designs; building and evaluating models; developing visualizations of model results.Candidates should have a Master's Degree (or Bachelor's degree with equivalent experience) from an accredited college or university in Operations Research, Statistics, Epidemiology, Biostatistics, Applied Mathematics, Industrial Engineering, Economics, or other technical degree in a relevant field. Ideal candidates will have advanced analytical skills, with demonstrated experience with analyses such as predictive analytics, survival analysis, longitudinal modeling, network analysis, and optimization.Responsibilities:Serves as a remote team Data Scientist in the Office of the Deputy Undersecretary of the Army, Army Analytics Group's Research Facilitation Laboratory located in
